intro: Gaultheria aperta, commonly known as the open bilberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with evergreen leaves that are elliptic in shape and covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and typically pink or white, appearing in clusters. Gaultheria aperta produces small, dark blue berries that are edible and contain high levels of antioxidants.
